visualization_prompt: Generate an areaspline chart showing weekly fruit consumption trends using animated time control navigation
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two-dimensional time-series data with 9 weekly observations across 7 categorical time points (days). The primary series shows synthetic fruit consumption values (range: 1-12 units) following an upward trend (μ=6.2, σ=3.1) with intentional weekly volatility, while the reference series represents a 7-week moving average (μ=6.7, σ=0.8) demonstrating central tendency. Data quality is artificially consistent with domain-appropriate ranges for food consumption metrics. The areaspline visualization maximizes data-ink ratio through continuous filled areas while maintaining categorical clarity through labeled weekdays. Perceptual grouping is reinforced using semi-transparent fill (60% opacity) and a dashed reference line. Animation controls follow Cairo's principles of progressive disclosure, allowing users to isolate temporal patterns while maintaining spatial orientation through the persistent average overlay. Color contrast (blue vs gray) ensures immediate series differentiation without legend reliance.
